results.title: Telling tales
results.brief_description:
Telling Tales are real stories told and produced by people with a disability and those who are disadvantaged.
Telling Tales challenges the ‘norms’ as often represented by mainstream film with first person accounts that provide a real opportunity to be seen and heard. The stories explore personal journeys of identity, displacement, relationships, longing and memory.
Telling Tales was produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for Telling Tales

results.title: A different perspective
results.brief_description: ‘I was given a photo pass to the 1994 Big Day Out. From then on, outside my day job I worked as a freelance photographer’. Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop ‘Telling Tales’.

results.title: The Astronomer
results.creator_credit: Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT and Kate McCartney
results.brief_description:
A paint-on-glass animation, “The Astronomer” is the story of an old timekeeper who, little by little, loses sense of his world. It is a quiet rumination on time, progress and disconnection, the delicate threads that forge identity and the ease with which we can be forgotten.
Created as part of coursework at the Centre for Animation and Interactive Media (AIM), RMIT, 2005.

results.title: A Monster's Voyage
results.creator_credit: Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT and Morag Porteous
results.brief_description:
A young girl and her loyal friend are on a voyage together. While they are self-sufficient and happy, nothing can stay the same forever. This artistically creative short animation expresses emotion and feeling in its story-telling and has a mythical quality of legends and folklore. Use of strong colours and hand-drawn animation.
Created as part of coursework at the Centre for Animation and Interactive Media (AIM), RMIT, 2005.

results.title: Birthday boy
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Andrew Gregory and Sejong Park
results.brief_description: Korea 1951 - little Manuk is playing on the streets of his village and dreaming of life at the front where his father is a soldier. He returns home to find a parcel on the doorstep and, thinking it is a birthday present, he opens it. But its contents will change his life.
